p: Between the time periods 2006–2010 and 2011–2015, new HIV diagnosis rates attributed to heterosexual contact decreased significantly in men born in South-East Asia (SRR 0.49, 95% CI 0.32–0.77), Southern and Central Asia (SRR 0.50, 95% CI 0.28–0.87) and Sub-Saharan Africa (SRR 0.39, 95% CI 0.28–0.52). Changes for other regions of birth were not significant.
